GuiCallback.desc: A class that holds the information needed to set up a window message callback.

msgNum.desc: The window message number. See link for available window messages.

function.desc: The function that should be called when the window message is received.

args.name: msgNum
args.desc: The window message number. See link for available window messages.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function to call when the window message is received.

ToStr.desc: Converts the object to a string.

args.name: indent
args.desc: The amount of indentation to add on each line.

hwnd.desc: The hwnd of the associated window.

callbacks.desc: The array of `GridGUI.GuiCallback`s that the class instance was created with.

__DetectHidden.desc: Enables the detection of hidden windows using other ahk commands.

returns.desc: The previous detect hidden windows state. Either `"On"` or `"Off"`.

args.name: hwnd
args.desc: The hwnd of the window that the class instance should work on.

args.name: callbacks
args.desc: An array of `GridGUI.GuiCallback`s to set up.

__Setup.desc: Sets up the `GridGUI.GuiCallback`s that where passed to the constructor. They are set up using `OnMessage`

ControlGetFocus.desc: Retrieves the hwnd of the control with input focus in the window if any.

returns.desc: The hwnd of the control with input focus or an empty string if non where found.

ToStr.desc: Converts the object to a string.

args.name: indent
args.desc: The amount of indentation to add on each line.

returns.desc: The hwnd of the window associated with this class instance if it is the active window otherwise `false`.
The hwnd of the window associated with this class instance if it exists otherwise `false`.

args.name: SubCommand
args.desc: The subcommand to retrive from the window. See the link for available subcommands.

WinGetPos.desc: A thin method wrapper for `WinGetPos`, except that it returns a `GridGUI.Position` instance.

returns.desc: The position and size of the window.

args.name: x
args.desc: The x coordinate that the top left corner of the window will be moved to. If left empty the x coordinate of the top left corner won't change.

args.name: y
args.desc: The y coordinate that the top left corner of the window will be moved to. If left empty the y coordinate of the top left corner won't change.

args.name: w
args.desc: The width the window should be resized to. If left empty the width won't change.

args.name: h
args.desc: The height the window should be resized to. If left empty the height won't change.

WinSet.desc: A thin method wrapper for `WinSet`, except it works even if the window is hidden.

args.name: SubCommand
args.desc: The subCommand to set for the window. See link for available subcommands.

args.name: value
args.desc: The value to apply to the subcommand. See link for values used in the subcommands.
